catalog_info.title: Genome Editing - Progress and Frontiers
catalog_info.notes: Tu., 10–11:30, and a two hour section weekly Students will be required to attend all lectures and to participate in all weekly sections. A mid-term exam will be given and students will be required to submit a final paper consisting of a research proposal.
catalog_info.description: This course will provide a comprehensive and cutting-edge primer on the burgeoning field of targeted genome editing. Topics discussed will include foundational science, recent rapid technological advances, and research and therapeutic applications of engineered zinc-finger nucleases, TALENs, and CRISPR-Cas nucleases. The class will meet twice per week, including a one-and-a-half hour lecture and a two-hour section in which students will discuss and critique original scientific papers relevant to that week's subject.
